title: Apple seeks to sidestep Big Tech's monopoly row as investigations pile up
text:
The set-piece events at which Apple unveils its latest inventions to the world are put together with the same meticulous planning and millimetre precision as the company’s gadgets, but as any events veteran will testify, something can always go wrong.

This June, when the company held its annual developer conference in Silicon Valley, there was no live demo fail or wardrobe malfunction to speak of. But as the company’s well-rehearsed executives strode around the stage, another piece of news rippled through the crowd.

With unfortunate timing, a US Congressional committee announced that it had launched a “top to bottom” investigation into whether America’s top tech companies exploit their power...
